cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest tonight, cross central and western Cuba Monday, enter the Florida Straits, then move northward just offshore the west coast of Florida toward the southeastern United States.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (near the Tampa Bay/Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect only for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas (not including mainland south-east Florida).
weather_observation.warning_coast: No Florida warnings in force; warnings confined to Jamaica and much of Cuba.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Cayman Islands, Florida Keys, west coast of Florida, and later the southeastern U.S. coastline.
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (Atlantic side only minor 1-2 ft water rise possible)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤13% chance) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts to 35–40 mph possible Monday night–Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible along Biscayne Bay during times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy showers Monday–Wednesday; storm-total rainfall generally 2–4 in., locally up to 6 in.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf along Atlantic beaches beginning Monday.
